subtitle: Okay yeah so because obviously in society our education system
is not... it's the opposite of spirituality really, even you know primary school or elementary school
and universities it gets worse really as you carry on, in reality, um and because of that we don't have
words to describe all these energies that can occur in the body... when you have these experiences
of these energies, and you know the general rule of thumb is any energies that appear we have to
try and stay impartial towards them so that we can continue with patience and have a longer
meditation, and also you know have that clarity of mind and not be identified or not be too
fascinated with it, but yeah we can have this kind of intelligence which understands it and
the thing is it's not that there are new energies entering the body - we just grow up conditioned in
a way that when we grow up our soul enters our physical body and we have
a certain type of energy, certain type of vibration and that never changes generally speaking until we
make some conscious effort in our lives which you know which we call spiritual practice, this
this process this work of becoming something higher, and anyway before that we have a sort of
energy flow - let's say our energy is always going in a certain direction since
from a child to when we're uh, until we're like, for the rest of our life from
zero to 50... let's say energies are always going down like this going down down down down down
we don't know we have energy because it's always going in the same direction right
and sometimes we feel certain energies throughout our lifetime because we have awe about something
or something amazing happens or something really bad happens, we lose a loved one, or perhaps we win
the lottery and we think it's amazing and then we feel certain types of energies, or perhaps we
go to a very nice beautiful temple with lots of monks doing mantras and we feel something,
so when we do these practices you know all those energies are going down down down down down,
you know I don't know they could be going any way right it's not as simple as that, but
while going down down down when you're like 20 or 21 you find spirituality, you start to have
perhaps foreign energies coming from somewhere else that you would you wouldn't ever usually feel
if you didn't live a spiritual life, you didn't live a spiritual practice, so you could have
foreign energies you know like cosmic energies or we start to move the flow of energies
and currents in different ways and that's when we say you know "whoa what are these energies?
what's happening?" and as I said in the guided meditation our "emotion" of the body or in other words
"motion", we have these "motions" in the body right, and we are a sort of karmic energetic makeup of our
emotions and those emotions manifest in certain parts of the body and so perhaps we have a certain
block, you know a very common term isn't it in spirituality to say that
one has blocks, and so perhaps there's certain mental blocks that we have, and through
spiritual practices we're being a different way than we wouldn't usually be in our
normal usual karmic way, and then when we practice... boom, certain energies open up
or perhaps we have certain emotions all our life, we've been having these recurrent
karmic emotions, negative emotions in our stomach,
you know it manifests in our stomach, you know how science says that anger can
damage the liver or kidneys or something like that well perhaps we stop being angry for
two weeks, three weeks, when usually you are angry every single day and you know that has
a massive effect on your health and energ...y so when you stop being angry for like uh
two or three days then it's like a damn breaking, sometimes when you are so patient and you
keep being consistent in meditation and you feel. you know and you ask. these questions
"uh something happened and I can't explain it, but it was amazing"... so yeah
